comments:
This is an error logged by the framework.  Observe how the severity level is set to 0 (OK).  It should be 4 (Error).

Currently, such an error shows up with a checkmark (for OK) in the log view instead of a red X.

!ENTRY initial@reference:file:plugins/org.eclipse.equinox.registry_1.0.0.v20051214a.jar/ 0 0 2006-01-10 00:23:36.459

!MESSAGE FrameworkEvent.ERROR
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.registry.TableReader.loadExtensionPointTree(TableReader.java:296)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.registry.RegistryObjectManager.load(RegistryObjectManager.java:355)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.registry.RegistryObjectManager.basicGetObject(RegistryObjectManager.java:206)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.registry.RegistryObjectManager.getObject(RegistryObjectManager.java:198)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.registry.RegistryObjectManager.getExtensionPointObject(RegistryObjectManager.java:264)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.registry.ExtensionRegistry.removeExtension(ExtensionRegistry.java:517)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.registry.ExtensionRegistry.removeExtensionsAndExtensionPoints(ExtensionRegistry.java:554)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.registry.ExtensionRegistry.basicRemove(ExtensionRegistry.java:222)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.registry.ExtensionRegistry.remove(ExtensionRegistry.java:506)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.registry.osgi.EclipseBundleListener.removeBundle(EclipseBundleListener.java:90)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.registry.osgi.EclipseBundleListener.bundleChanged(EclipseBundleListener.java:71)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleContextImpl.dispatchEvent(BundleContextImpl.java:1205)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.eventmgr.EventManager.dispatchEvent(EventManager.java:189)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.eventmgr.ListenerQueue.dispatchEventSynchronous(ListenerQueue.java:141)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.Framework.publishBundleEventPrivileged(Framework.java:1485)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.Framework.publishBundleEvent(Framework.java:1436)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.PackageAdminImpl.processDelta(PackageAdminImpl.java:360)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.PackageAdminImpl.doResolveBundles(PackageAdminImpl.java:191)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.PackageAdminImpl$1.run(PackageAdminImpl.java:139)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:534)

Fixed for M5

The fixed required that the FrameworkLogEntry have new fields added for severity and bundle code.  Before this clients were required to append int strings to the entry text to convey severity and bundle-specific codes (not sure why we did that in the first place).  Now clients can construct FrameworkLogEntry objects with severity and bundle-specific codes set and they will be written correctly to the log.  Old clients can still use the old constructor for FrameworkLogEntry and pass the severity and bundle-specific codes as part of the entry text (although I think we will end up deprecating this constructor).

The framework now uses this to properly log errors and warnings instead of OK log entries.
*** Bug 79515 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
